title: ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi 'killed in US special forces raid in Syria'
text:

ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi has been killed after a US special forces raid, according to reports.

Donald Trump is said to have ordered the mission in northern Syria.

A Pentagon source told Newsweek the terrorist commander was "dead pending verification", but this remains unconfirmed.

It comes after President Trump tweeted: "Something very big has just happened!" He gave no further details.

White House spokesman Hogan Gidley said Trump would give a "major statement" at 9am (1pm UK time).

A US official said a top-secret operation was carried out on one of the last ISIS bastions in Syria.

This was to locate a "high-value" target - said to be al-Baghdadi.

(Image: Getty)

A military source confirmed to Reuters news agency that the US had launched an operation against the ISIS leader, but it was

Newsweek reports the US Defense Department told the White House it had "high confidence" al-Baghdadi was killed, but this still needs to be verified.

Operatives from the Joint Special Operations Command carried out the high-level operation on Saturday, the report adds.

It came after valuable new intelligence from Syria.

Al-Baghdadi became active in al-Qaeda following the US-led invasion of Iraq in 2003 and spent time in the infamous Abu Ghraib detention centre.

The Iraqi-born cleric, believed to be 47 or 48, became leader of ISIS in 2010 and led the terror group to huge territorial gains across Iraq and Syria.

He declared the global caliphate in 2014 in Mosul - his only known public appearance as ISIS leader.

Under his leadership, ISIS fought back government forces in Syria and Iraq, claiming huge areas of oil-rich land.

Its terrorists also murdered thousands of people in incredible acts of brutality - including captive Westerners who were beheaded on camera.

(Image: US DEPARTMENT OF STATE)

Meanwhile ISIS sympathisers have launched terror attacks in Britain, Germany, France and beyond in recent years.

But ISIS's territory has collapsed following Western-backed interventions - and surviving terrorists have been forced into hiding in a few remaining strongholds.

Al-Baghdadi was last seen in a propaganda video in April.

The US placed a $25million bounty on his head in 2016.

Trump is expected to make his "major statement" in the White House Diplomatic Reception Room, which he has used to make a number of important announcements.

Just last week he used the same room to announce that a ceasefire between Turkey and the Kurds had taken hold.

We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.
description: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi is "dead pending verification" following a top-secret raid, according to a Pentagon source quoted in US media
